The final shape will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, having dimensions of 2 units in length (X-axis), 1 unit in width (Y-axis), and approximately 0.5 units in height (Z-axis). The height includes the 0.4824-unit rectangular prism and a 0.0174-unit height cylindrical tapered shape with the same width as the prism. On this face, create a single loop (loop\\_1) using the following instructions: * Create a circle (circle\\_1) with the following properties: - Center: [0.375, 0.375] - Radius: 0.375 Close the loop. Extrude the sketch using the following parameters: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.1 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.75 * Operation: Create a new solid body. This will create the first cylindrical object with the specified height, width, and length. **Part 2: Construct a smaller cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom. The object has a slightly tapered shape, narrowing slightly towards the bottom.** Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0732, 0.001, 0.0732] Create a new 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. On this sketch, create a single face (face\\_1). On this face, create a single loop (loop\\_1) using the following instructions: * Create a circle (circle\\_1) with the following properties: - Center: [0.125, 0.125] - Radius: 0.125 Close the loop. Extrude the sketch using the following parameters: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.001 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.25 * Operation: Join with the previous body. This will create the second, smaller cylindrical object and join it with the first one. The resulting object will have a slightly tapered shape and a flat top and bottom. The top and bottom edges will be sharp and straight. The object is centered in the image.</description>

Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. **Sketch 1**: Create face 1 on the XY plane and construct loop 1 as follows: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0188, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.0188, 0.0], End Point [0.0188, 0.75] * Line 3: Start Point [0.0188, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] **Extrusion 1**: Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.5625 units. Part 2: Construct a long, thin, cylindrical object with a slightly tapered end. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector of [0.0094, 0.0, 0.0312]. **Sketch 2**: Create face 1 on the XY plane and construct loop 1 as follows: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0094, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.0094, 0.0], End Point [0.0094, 0.0094] * Line 3: Start Point [0.0094, 0.0094], End Point [0.0, 0.0094] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0094], End Point [0.0, 0.0] **Extrusion 2**: Cut the sketch by 0.7406 units along the negative Z-axis. The dimensions of the final shape are approximately 2 units (length) by 3 units (width) by 4 units (height). The tapered top and bottom faces have a height of 0.5625 units. The long, thin, cylindrical object has a length of 0.0094 units, a width of 0.7406 units, and a height of 0.0094 units. Please note that these dimensions are relative to the coordinate systems and transformations defined in the parts.</description>
